alert.note: Alert for Butler; Harvey; Kingman; Reno; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 11:52PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong winds will impact portions of Reno, Sedgwick, western Harvey, central Butler and northeastern Kingman Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1151 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds along a line extending from near Arlington to 7 miles northeast of Valley Center to 14 miles east of Burns. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Hutchinson, Derby, Newton, El Dorado, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Goddard, Hesston, Maize, Kingman, South Hutchinson, Cheney, Halstead, Sedgwick and Towanda. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 22, and between Mile Markers 38 and 41. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 41 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for south central and southeastern Kansas.
